title.narrative: Water, Sanitation and Hygiene Support to IDPs in 2 LGAs of Plateau State, Nigeria

description.narrative: Plateau State is not new to inter-communal violence. Over 38,000 persons were displaced by the latest violence in the State in late June 2018. With many displaced families taking refuge in Jos as internally displaced persons (IDPs). JDPC Jos, through its Emergency Preparedness and Response Team (EPRT), an inter-agency and inter-faith coalition conducted humanitarian situation assessments. Report of the assessment visits draws attention to the plight of people displaced by the recent violent attacks on several communities. The immediate needs of the victims are food, non-food items, water, sanitation and hygiene (WASH) support as a short-term intervention; while psychosocial support, women and youth empowerment, building bridges of trust through peacebuilding and conflict transformation as well as re-settlement of the IDPs was identified as long-term needs. Through this project, the dignity and privacy of men, women, boys and girls will be ensured through the provision of water, sanitation and hygiene materials and messages. Dignity kits including sanitary wears will be provided for women and girls. Gender segregated latrines will be constructed. Most vulnerable categories will be targeted and inequalities in access will be addressed. This project will also lead to prevention of outbreaks of contaminated and airborne diseases such as cholera, and would aim at developing a health conscious IDP camps and host communities. Complaints and feedback mechanism will be established to enable target communities/camp to air their views about the project. This project's outcomes include 1. Improved access to sanitation facilities in emergency affected communities 2. Improved access to safe drinking water in affected communities and camps 3.
